etymology.description: Pictogram: two bent lines indicating “to divide”; later borrowed to mean “eight” via homophony (original sense now in 分, 別).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts two strokes diverging to suggest splitting or separation. Later became a rebus for the number eight because it shared the same sound, while the original sense lived on in 分 and 別. Not the “two hands” component found in other characters.

examples.chinese: 我有八本书(我有八本書)。
我买了八个苹果(我買了八個蘋果)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le bā gè píngguǒ.
